title: An introduction to managing diversity, equity and inclusion
displayTitle: An introduction to managing diversity, equity and inclusion
body:
In this topic you will learn about the following.

  • The meaning of workplace diversity, equity, and inclusion
  • Benefits of a diverse workforce
  • Strategies to measure diversity and inclusion within a workplace

_items.title: Inclusive
_items.body: An environment where members or employees feel respected and connected to each other.

_items.title: Bias
_items.body: A prejudicial viewpoint against a specific person or group.

_items.title: Recruitment
_items.body: The process of finding or attracting candidates for a position.

_items.title: Selection
_items.body: The process of choosing the best candidate for a position.

_items.title: Implicit bias
_items.body: Implicit bias or unconscious bias is automatic or unconscious attitudes towards others. This is usually based on stereotypes and commonly results in unfair treatment.

_items.title: Misgendering
_items.body: Is when the language used to refer to a person, e.g. pronouns, doesn’t align with that person’s affirmed gender.
